alert.note: Alert for Bristol (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 13 at 12:50PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern Rhode Island, including the following area, Bristol RI. * WHEN...From 11 PM EDT this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are expected to move into the Watch area later tonight, with additional rounds of showers and thunderstorms capable of heavy rainfall for the overnight hours. This may produce street and urban flooding along with sharp rises on creeks and streams in the Watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
